marklogic.body: It felt kind of sloppy to me in the beginning as well, but by the second half of the 90 minutes I was back in the groove. It seems to me this season is about cranking up the on everyone's personality traits. Sterling is more Sterling, Campbell is more Campbell. Also, the Heat seemed to play an interesting role. I could see a DO THE RIGHT THING type gimmick where the temperature gets hotter as tensions rise. Maybe that’s too on the nose for Wiener? The only person who seemed less himself was Don, which is probably a sign of what's to come. If I had to guess, he will snap out of the Megan thing once he realizes the company is on the verge of failing. He will Gain control at the cost of losing her. But alone and bitter is kind of Don's sweet Spot.
